alert.note: Alert for Black Hawk; Bremer; Butler; Grundy; Jasper; Marshall; Poweshiek; Tama (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 13 at 3:35AM CST until January 13 at 6:00AM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Blizzard Conditions Continue Today... ...Life Threatening Wind Chills Expected Today into Early Next Week... .A multi-faceted dangerous winter storm will continue to affect Iowa today. This dangerous storm will bring additional light snow across much of the state today with additional accumulations generally an inch or less. Winds will continue to increase, with life threatening blizzard conditions, especially this afternoon to evening across portions of central and northern Iowa. Dangerous temperatures follow this weekend through early next week, with wind chill values down to 45 below zero expected. ...BLIZZARD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero at times. * WHERE...Portions of central, northern, and northeast Iowa. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 6 AM CST early this morning. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 AM this morning to 6 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact travel throughout today. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The Iowa Department of Transportation reports travel not advised across much of central Iowa, with some roads impassable due to blowing and drifting snow. Towing is not recommended over the much of the area so you may be stranded if an accident occurs.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest travel conditions, check the Iowa 511 app, www.511ia.org, or dial 511.
